metadata.title: LT: How to Request a 401(k) Termination Cash Withdrawal or Rollover
metadata.description: Guide a former employee through requesting a termination distribution from a ForUsAll-administered 401(k), including cash withdrawal, rollover, or a split transaction, using the participant portal or a RightSignature electronic form when portal access is not possible. This article is specific to the recordkeeper LT Trust.

summary.purpose: Help an agent determine eligibility and guide a terminated participant through requesting a 401(k) termination distribution (cash, rollover, or split) using the ForUsAll participant portal, with a RightSignature electronic form as a fallback when portal access is not possible due to MFA access issues.
key_business_rules: Participant must have Terminated status and a termination date; if a rehire date exists, termination date must be after the rehire date.
Only vested balances are eligible for distribution.
Participant must have MFA enrolled to access the participant portal; if portal access is not possible due to MFA access issues, a RightSignature electronic form can be requested as a slower option.
Account balance must be greater than 75.00 to proceed; if balance is less than or equal to 75.00, the $75 distribution fee may reduce the distribution to 0.00.
A $75 distribution fee applies to all requests; no additional charges apply for ACH or regular mail check.
An additional $35 fee applies for wire or overnight check delivery, and wire transfer and overnight check fees are non-refundable.
For cash distributions, 20% mandatory federal withholding applies and state withholding may also apply; cash distributions are taxable income for the calendar year processed.
Wires require exact instructions to avoid rejections and returns; a returned wire may be converted to a mailed check.
key_steps_summary: Log in to the ForUsAll participant portal and open Loans & Distributions.
Select the distribution reason (Separation of Service; if unavailable select Default).
Review sources and vesting, then enter email confirmation information.
Choose distribution type (cash, rollover, or split) and delivery method, then provide the required delivery and receiving institution details.

Review elections (including withholding) and submit the request, then track review, processing, and delivery timelines; if portal access is not possible due to MFA access issues, request a RightSignature electronic form from ForUsAll Support.

high_impact_faq_pairs.question: What should I do if Separation of Service is not available as a reason?
high_impact_faq_pairs.answer: Select Default and proceed. If unsure whether separation is recorded, contact ForUsAll Support.

high_impact_faq_pairs.question: What fees apply to a termination distribution request?
high_impact_faq_pairs.answer: A $75 distribution fee applies to all requests. An additional $35 fee applies if you choose wire delivery or an overnight check, and those fees are non-refundable.

high_impact_faq_pairs.question: What are the delivery timelines for checks and wires?
high_impact_faq_pairs.answer: ForUsAll reviews within about two business days. Checks typically arrive in about 2–3 weeks after approval via USPS, and wires typically complete in about 1–2 weeks after approval depending on the receiving institution.

high_impact_faq_pairs.question: What taxes apply to a cash distribution?
high_impact_faq_pairs.answer: A 20% federal withholding applies and state withholding may also apply. The distribution is taxable income for the calendar year processed.

high_impact_faq_pairs.question: Can I request a distribution before my termination date is in the system?
high_impact_faq_pairs.answer: No. You must have a termination date in the system to request a distribution.

plan_specific_guardrails: Do not claim a participant can request a termination distribution without a termination date and Terminated status.
Do not state that unvested funds can be distributed; only vested balances are eligible.
Do not claim the wire or overnight check fee can be refunded; these fees are non-refundable.
Do not guarantee whether state withholding will apply or specify state withholding amounts; only state that it may apply.
Do not promise exact delivery dates; use only the stated approximate timelines.

rules: The participant must have a Terminated status & Termination date in the system.
Only vested balances are eligible for distribution.
If there is a Rehire date in the system, the Termination date must be after or higher than the Rehire date.
Not mentioned from the Plan Data, that the plan is in a Blackout period.
The Participant must have MFA enrolled for participant portal access.
A $75 distribution fee applies to all requests.
No additional charges apply for ACH or Regular Mail Check.
An additional $35 wire fee applies if a wire or OverNight Check is chosen.
Wire transfer and OverNight Check fees are non-refundable.
For cash distributions, 20% federal MANDATORY withholding applies.
State withholding may also apply (Subject to the state's tax laws).
Cash distributions are taxable income for the calendar year processed.
Submitting through the participant portal is the preferred and fastest route.
If portal access is not possible due to MFA access issues, the participant can request a RightSignature electronic form as a slower secondary option.
Checks are sent via USPS or UPS.
Wires require exact instructions to avoid rejections and returns.
A returned wire may be converted to a mailed check.

fees.notes: Applies in addition to the Distribution request fee if a wire is chosen; non-refundable.
Applies in addition to the Distribution request fee if an OverNight Check is chosen; non-refundable.

steps.description: The participant must log in to the ForUsAll 401(k) participant portal and open the 'Loans & Distributions' area from the dashboard.
steps.notes: Portal submission is the fastest route. The participant must use the portal login URL provided in references.

steps.description: The participant must select a distribution reason for the request.
steps.notes: The participant must choose Separation of Service. If Separation of Service is unavailable, the participant must choose Default and continue.

steps.description: The participant must review account sources and vesting before continuing.
steps.notes: The portal shows Traditional and any Roth sources and vesting percentages. Only vested balances are eligible. If vesting looks incorrect, the participant must contact ForUsAll Support before submitting.

steps.description: The participant must enter email confirmation information.
steps.notes: The participant must expand Email Confirmation Information and enter at least one valid email address for updates or inquiries.

steps.description: The participant must choose the distribution type and how funds will be delivered.
steps.notes: The participant must choose from the following options: lump sum cash distribution, full rollover to an IRA or qualified plan, or partial rollover plus partial cash.

steps.description: The participant must provide delivery details for the chosen option.
steps.notes: For checks, the participant must provide a mailing address and (for cash) any additional withholding if selected. For wires, the participant must provide required routing and account details. For rollovers, the participant must provide the receiving institution information and IRA or sub-account number if applicable.

steps.description: The participant must review elections and submit the request in the portal.
steps.notes: The participant must confirm distribution elections, tax withholding, and delivery method, then submit. A confirmation screen summarizes choices. If the confirmation screen shows 'none' for email confirmation after an email was entered, this is a known display issue and can be ignored.

steps.description: The participant must track review, processing, and delivery timelines after submission.
steps.notes: ForUsAll reviews within about two business days. Checks typically arrive in about 2–3 weeks after approval via USPS. Wires typically complete in about 1–2 weeks after approval depending on the receiving institution. OverNight Check timelines should be treated the same as regular checks.

common_issues.issue: Cannot log in or access the participant portal due to Participant data 'MFA' is 'not enrolled'.
common_issues.resolution: The participant must enroll MFA in the participant portal. The participant must use the portal login URL provided in references, click on 'New here? Create an Account' and follow the instructions to create an account. The participant must be advised that they must use the email on file to correctly create an account.

common_issues.issue: The participant cannot log in or access the participant portal and Participant data 'MFA' is 'enrolled' (Participant doesn't mention they have forgotten their password).
common_issues.resolution: The participant must call the Participant Support team at '844-401-2253' to reset their MFA.

common_issues.issue: The participant cannot log in or access the participant portal due to Participant have forgotten their password.
common_issues.resolution: The participant must use the portal login URL provided in references, click on 'Forgot your password?' and follow the instructions to reset their password. The participant must be advised that they must use the email on file to correctly reset their password.

common_issues.issue: The participant cannot log in or access the participant portal due to error '10051'.
common_issues.resolution: Advise the participant to contact ForUsAll Support to confirm their account information.

common_issues.issue: The Participant mentions that the Separation of Service reason is not listed.
common_issues.resolution: The participant must select Default and proceed. If unsure whether separation is recorded, the Participant must contact ForUsAll Support.

common_issues.issue: The Participant mentions that the Account Balance is 0.
common_issues.resolution: The Participant must contact ForUsAll Support

common_issues.issue: The Participant mentions that the Vesting percentage appears incorrect.
common_issues.resolution: Do not submit the distribution request yet. Contact ForUsAll Support to review vesting records before proceeding.

common_issues.issue: Email confirmation shows 'none' on the confirmation screen.
common_issues.resolution: This is a known display issue. If a valid email was entered in the Email Confirmation Information section, the 'none' label can be ignored.

common_issues.issue: Check or Wirenot received after the expected timeframe.
common_issues.resolution: Allow about 2–3 weeks from approval for processing and delivery times. If overdue, the Participant must contact ForUsAll Support.

common_issues.issue: The Participant is unsure about taxes for a cash distribution.
common_issues.resolution: Explain that 20% federal withholding applies and state withholding may also apply, and that the distribution is taxable income for the calendar year processed. Recommend consulting a tax professional for personal circumstances.

common_issues.issue: The participant has already tried the common troubleshooting steps and is still experiencing issues or the issue mentioned is not listed in the common issues.
common_issues.resolution: Advise the participant to contact ForUsAll Support to resolve the issue.

examples.scenario: Participant wants a taxable cash payout to a personal bank via wire.
examples.outcome: Use Lump Sum Cash Distribution with wire delivery. Provide complete bank routing and account details and a mailing address. Expect a $75 distribution fee plus a $35 wire fee, and 20% federal withholding (plus any applicable state withholding).

examples.scenario: Participant wants to roll 100% to a Traditional IRA at Fidelity.
examples.outcome: Use Full Rollover with check or wire delivery. If using a wire, list the receiving institution as the bank account name and include routing and account details and the IRA sub-account number. If a wire returns, a rollover check may be mailed instead.

examples.scenario: Participant wants to split 60% to an IRA and 40% as cash.
examples.outcome: Use Partial Rollover plus Partial Cash and provide delivery instructions for each portion by percentage or dollar amount, including separate check or wire details as needed.

examples.scenario: Vesting shows 80% but the participant expected 100%.
examples.outcome: Do not proceed with submission until vesting is reviewed. Only vested amounts are eligible, so the participant should contact ForUsAll Support to review vesting.

notes: ForUsAll reviews distribution requests within about two business days.
Checks typically arrive in about 2–3 weeks after approval via USPS.
Wires typically complete in about 1–2 weeks after approval depending on the receiving institution.
A $75 distribution fee applies to all requests.
An additional $35 fee applies if a wire or overnight check is chosen and is non-refundable.
For cash distributions, 20% mandatory federal withholding applies and state withholding may also apply.
Cash distributions are taxable income for the calendar year processed.
An additional 10% early withdrawal penalty applies if the participant is under 59 1/2 years old.
The portal displays Traditional and any Roth sources.
Ensure the receiving account accepts the tax character of the funds (for example, Roth IRA for Roth amounts).
If portal access is not possible, a RightSignature electronic form can be requested from ForUsAll Support and is typically slower than portal submission.

faq_pairs.question: Where do the funds go in a termination distribution or rollover?
faq_pairs.answer: Funds move from the ForUsAll plan out to the participant or another institution as a distribution or outgoing rollover.

faq_pairs.question: What should I do if Separation of Service is not available as a reason?
faq_pairs.answer: Select Default and proceed. If unsure whether separation is recorded, contact ForUsAll Support.

faq_pairs.question: What are the delivery timelines for checks and wires?
faq_pairs.answer: ForUsAll reviews within about two business days. Checks typically arrive in about 2–3 weeks after approval via USPS, and wires typically complete in about 1–2 weeks after approval depending on the receiving institution.

faq_pairs.question: What taxes apply to a cash distribution?
faq_pairs.answer: A 20% federal withholding applies and state withholding may also apply. The distribution is taxable income for the calendar year processed.

faq_pairs.question: Will ForUsAll help complete all required fields on this form?
faq_pairs.answer: No. While this is a ForUsAll form, certain required fields must be completed using information provided directly by the other financial institution. ForUsAll is unable to supply or verify information that must come from an external company. If you’re unsure what information is needed, we recommend contacting the advisor or representative at the other institution so they can provide the correct details for you to enter on the form or request.

faq_pairs.question: Im gonna left my employer in a future date, can I request a distribution now?
faq_pairs.answer: No, you can't request a distribution now. You must have a termination date in our system to request a distribution.

faq_pairs.question: Im gonna left my employer in a future date, what options do I have?
faq_pairs.answer: Once you have a termination date, you can: request a full cash distribution, request a full rollover, or request a partial rollover plus partial cash.

definitions.definition: A distribution reason used when a participant has left their employer and is requesting a termination distribution.
A payment to the participant that is taxable and subject to required withholding.
A distribution sent to an IRA or qualified plan instead of being paid directly to the participant.
The portion of the account balance that is eligible for distribution based on vesting percentage.
An electronic form used to request a distribution when portal submission is not possible.
The amount of tax that is withheld from a cash distribution to the participant.
A penalty that is applied to a distribution if the participant is under 59 1/2 years old.

must_not: Do not state that unvested funds can be distributed; only vested balances are eligible.
Do not promise exact delivery dates; use the stated approximate timelines only.
Do not guarantee whether state withholding will apply or specify state withholding amounts.
Do not claim the wire fee can be refunded; the wire fee is non-refundable.
Do not claim where or how to access any document other than the portal URL and contact methods explicitly provided.
Do not claim that ForUsAll will help complete all required fields on this form.
Do not disclose account balances or vesting percentages, or any other sensitive information.
must_do_if_unsure: Advise the participant to contact ForUsAll Support if vesting percentages or account sources appear incorrect.
Advise the participant to contact ForUsAll Support if portal access issues prevent online submission.
Advise the participant to contact ForUsAll Support if employment separation status appears uncertain or not reflected in the portal options.
Advise the participant to contact ForUsAll Support if they are unsure about the information needed to complete the form.

must_have.meaning: The date the participant terminated their employment.
must_have.why_needed: To verify eligibility for distribution, without a termination date, the participant cannot proceed with the request.

must_have.meaning: The date the participant was rehired.
must_have.why_needed: To verify eligibility for distribution, to be eligible, rehire date must be before to the termination date.

must_have.meaning: The status of the participant's MFA enrollment.
must_have.why_needed: To verify access to the participant portal, without a MFA enrollment, the participant cannot proceed with the request since they cannot log in to the portal.

must_have.meaning: The total balance of the participant's account.
must_have.why_needed: To verify eligibility for distribution, the account balance must be greater than 75.00. If the account balance is less than or equal to 75.00, the distribution fee may reduce the account to 0.00 and no funds may be distributed to the participant.

must_have.meaning: The date of the participant's last payroll.
must_have.why_needed: Used to confirm there are no pending contributions; it is better if the last payroll date is more than 1 week before the distribution request so all participant funds are available.
must_have.source_note: Supported by article section: Prerequisites, Step 5, Step 6, and Common Issues

must_have.why_needed: Required to confirm that we found a user related to the participant in our system.

must_have.meaning: The status of the participant in the system.
must_have.why_needed: Required to confirm that the participant has already left their employer in order to request a distribution.

nice_to_have.meaning: The type of distribution requested by the participant.
nice_to_have.why_needed: Determines the type of distribution requested by the participant.
nice_to_have.source_note: Supported by article section: Prerequisites and Step 5

if_missing.ask_participant: Have you already left your employer and what was your last day of employment?
if_missing.agent_note: If the participant has not left their employer, they cannot proceed with the request.

if_missing.ask_participant: Were you rehired after leaving this employer? If yes, what was your rehire date?
if_missing.agent_note: If a rehire date exists, the termination date must be after the rehire date to be eligible.

if_missing.ask_participant: Have you enrolled MFA in the participant portal?
if_missing.agent_note: MFA is required for participant portal access. If the participant cannot enroll MFA and cannot access the portal, advise requesting a RightSignature electronic form from ForUsAll Support.

if_missing.ask_participant: Is your 401(k) account balance greater than 75.00?
if_missing.agent_note: If the balance is less than or equal to 75.00, the distribution fee may reduce the account to 0.00 and no funds may be distributed to the participant.

if_missing.ask_participant: What was the date of your last payroll?
if_missing.agent_note: This helps confirm there are no pending contributions; it is better if the last payroll date is more than 1 week before the distribution request so all participant funds are available.

if_missing.ask_participant: Please provide your full name, the email address associated with your account, and the name of your company.
if_missing.agent_note: If this field is missing, it means that we couldn't find a user related to the participant in our system, this means that we cannot determine if the participant is eligible for a distribution.

if_missing.ask_participant: Are you currently marked as Terminated in your employer's records for the plan?
if_missing.agent_note: If the participant status and termination date are not consistent or are not up to date, advise contacting ForUsAll Support to confirm the information.

disambiguation_notes: If the participant's name is not found in our system, it means that we cannot determine if the participant is eligible for a distribution since, we won't be able to retrieve any of the must have data points.
If there's no termination date, it means that the participant is not eligible for a distribution since we need to know when the participant left their employer.

If there's a rehire date, previous to the termination date. Otherwise, if rehire date is greater than the termination date, it means that the participant is not eligible for a distribution since they are still employed.

eligibility_requirements: Participant must have a termination date
Participant must have an Account balance greater than 75.00
If Rehire date is not null, it must be before the termination date
Participant must have a MFA status of 'enrolled' for participant portal access
Participant must have a status of 'Terminated'
blocking_conditions: Participant doesn't have a termination date
Participant doesn't have an Account balance greater than 75.00
If Rehire date is not null, it is after the termination date
Participant have a MFA status of 'not enrolled' or is null for participant portal access

missing_data_conditions.condition: There is no name provided for the participant
missing_data_conditions.ask_participant: Please provide your full name, the email address associated with your account, and the name of your company.
What was your last day of employment?

allowed_conclusions: If a rehire date is present and it's after the termination date, the participant is not eligible for a distribution.
If the participant is eligible for a distribution, they can request a rollover or a cash distribution or a partial rollover or partial cash withdrawal.
not_allowed_conclusions: If no user is found in our system, or any of the data points are missing, this doesn't mean that the participant is not eligible for a distribution, we just need to confirm the information with the participant.
Do not claim unvested funds are eligible for distribution. Only vested balances are eligible for distribution.

If the participant has a Termination date, but is status is NOT 'Terminated', this indicates that the information is not up to date and the participant is not eligible to proceed until they contact ForUsAll Support to confirm the information.

If the participant status is 'Terminated', but doesn't have a Termination date, this indicates that the information is not up to date and the participant is not eligible to proceed until they contact ForUsAll Support to confirm the information.

participant_message_components: We confirmed you are eligible since you already have a termination date.
You can request a termination distribution in the ForUsAll participant portal under Loans & Distributions at the top right corner
Please follow the steps outlined in the article to request a distribution.
next_steps: Guide the participant through the portal steps in order to request a distribution.
If the participant mentions the type of distribution they want to request, be specific about the steps they need to follow.
warnings: For cash distributions, 20% federal withholding applies and state withholding may apply.
For cash distrobution be advised a possible 10% early withdrawal penalty may apply if you are under 59 1/2 years old.
For wire distribution be advised a possible additional fee will apply and this fee is non-refundable.
For overnight check distribution be advised a possible additional fee will apply and this fee is non-refundable.
Be advised the processing time for a wire is 1 to 2 weeks and checks are typically delivered in 2 to 3 weeks.
what_not_to_say: Do not promise exact delivery dates.
Do not state that the wire and overnight check fees can be refunded.
Do not state that unvested funds can be distributed.
Do not promise they can avoid the early withdrawal penalty
Do not specify additional state tax withholding amounts

participant_message_components: To guide you through the request, I need a few details about the type of distribution and delivery method you want.
You can submit through the portal under Loans & Distributions, or request a RightSignature electronic form if you cannot access the portal.
next_steps: Collect the missing details required for the participant's selected option (cash, rollover, or split) and delivery method (check or wire).
Once the missing details are available, provide the portal steps and the required entries for the chosen method.
warnings: Wire instructions must be exact and the wire fee is non-refundable.
questions_to_ask: Do you want a lump sum cash distribution, a full rollover, or a partial rollover plus partial cash?
What is at least one email address you want to use for confirmation updates?
What is your current mailing address for check delivery and contact?
If you are rolling over funds, what is the receiving institution and, if applicable, your IRA or account number?
If you want delivery by wire, what are the receiving bank name, routing or ABA number, account number, and the exact account name required by the bank?
what_not_to_say: Do not confirm the request can be completed without the missing delivery details.
Do not promise exact delivery dates.

participant_message_components: Only vested balances are eligible for distribution.
next_steps: Have the participant review vesting in the portal before submitting.
If vesting appears incorrect, advise contacting ForUsAll Support to review vesting records before proceeding.
what_not_to_say: Do not state that unvested amounts can be distributed.
